page.title: 07LOCAL CUSTOMS
page.content: {Loxley Chase.}Loxley Chase is an area of unenclosed ground near the village. We still have Chase Farm, Chase House & Chase Rd.{The Loxley Chase}is a five mile race run over paths and roads and anyone over 10 years of age can take part. This annual event includes a section for wheel chairs, and begins outside Loxley School. The winners are presented with medals. { The Chase is an old custom which has been revived in recent years. { CAKING NIGHT.}On October 31st caking night is celebrated. Children dress up in old clothes and fancy dress, hats, masks and makeup .They go round houses knocking on doors saying,"Cake, cake, cake. Copper, copper, copper .Oil a boil a water.Cake, cake, cake. They take collecting tins for money. People give them either cakes, buns or sweets or put money in the tin.
